001package org.consensusj.bitcoin.json.conversion;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.Version;
004import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.module.SimpleModule;
005import org.bitcoinj.base.Address;
006import org.bitcoinj.base.Network;
007import org.bitcoinj.core.Block;
008import org.bitcoinj.base.Coin;
009import org.bitcoinj.crypto.ECKey;
010import org.bitcoinj.base.Sha256Hash;
011import org.bitcoinj.core.Transaction;
012
013import java.util.Objects;
014
015// TODO: Consider merging RpcClientModule and RpcServerModule (though there are currently conflicting serializers for Transaction)
016/**
017 * Jackson Module with serializers and deserializers for JSON-RPC clients.
018 */
019public class RpcClientModule extends SimpleModule {
020    /**
021     * Create a client module without strict address parsing.
022     */
023    public RpcClientModule() {
024        this(null, false);
025    }
026
027    /**
028     * @param network Which network we are going to be a client for (may be null if {@code strictAddressParsing} is false)
029     * @param strictAddressParsing set to {@code true} to throw exceptions when deserializing addresses that don't match {@code network}
030     */
031    protected RpcClientModule(Network network, boolean strictAddressParsing) {
032        super("BitcoinJMappingClient", new Version(1, 0, 0, null, null, null));
033
034        this.addDeserializer(Address.class, strictAddressParsing ? new AddressDeserializer(Objects.requireNonNull(network)) : new AddressDeserializer())
035                .addDeserializer(Block.class, new BlockHexDeserializer())
036                .addDeserializer(Coin.class, new CoinDeserializer())
037                .addDeserializer(ECKey.class, new ECKeyDeserializer())
038                .addDeserializer(Sha256Hash.class, new Sha256HashDeserializer())
039                .addSerializer(Address.class, new AddressSerializer())
040                .addSerializer(Coin.class, new CoinSerializer())
041                .addSerializer(ECKey.class, new ECKeySerializer())
042                .addSerializer(Sha256Hash.class, new Sha256HashSerializer())
043                .addSerializer(Transaction.class, new TransactionHexSerializer());
044    }
045
046    /**
047     * Create a client module with strict address parsing. Will throw exceptions when deserializing addresses that don't match {@code network}.
048     * @param network Expected Network we are going to validate addresses for
049     */
050    public RpcClientModule(Network network) {
051        this(network, true);
052    }
053}
